prefix: Approach the following multiple choice question the way a doctor would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following multiple choice question the way a doctor would. A 60 yr old chronic smoker presents with painless gross hematuria of 1 day duration. Investigation of choice to know the cause of hematuria
1: USG
2: X-ray KUB
3: Urine routine
4: Urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells
gpt_response: As a doctor, when a 60-year-old chronic smoker presents with painless gross hematuria of 1 day duration, the investigation of choice to determine the cause of the hematuria would be option 4: Urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells. This test can help to identify any abnormal cells in the urine that may indicate a potential underlying malignancy such as bladder cancer. It is important to rule out any serious conditions in this patient population.
solution_prompt: The following is a response to a question, with options 1, 2, 3, 4. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response 4?: As a doctor, when a 60-year-old chronic smoker presents with painless gross hematuria of 1 day duration, the investigation of choice to determine the cause of the hematuria would be option 4: Urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells. This test can help to identify any abnormal cells in the urine that may indicate a potential underlying malignancy such as bladder cancer. It is important to rule out any serious conditions in this patient population.
